page.title: 06A Commuter's Day
page.content: Rivenhall village is only a short distance from Witham Railway Station.Many people in the area commute to London to work every day. This is a distance of approximately 60 miles. Mr.Cooper is a commuter who lives in the village but works in London.At 6.30.a.m. he gets up and gets ready for work.At 7.45.a.m. he leaves home arriving at Witham in time to catch the 7.59.a.m. train to London.At 8.50.a.m. he arrives in London and he reaches his office at 9.00.a.m.to start work at 9.30.a.m.He stops for lunch at 1.30.p.m.and leaves the office at 5.50.p.m. to catch the 6.02.p.m. train.He arrives back in Witham at 6.50.p.m.He eventually gets home at 7.06.p.m. after approximately a 12 hour day.
